description: This schema represents amount of calories burned in kilocalories (kcal) either as a single measurement, or as the result of aggregating several measurements made over time (see Descriptive statistic schema for a list of aggregate measures)

references.description: The LOINC code represents Calories burned:Power = Energy/Time:Point in time:^Patient:Quantitative, that is, a Quantitative measure of Calories burned by a Patient at a Point in time

effective_time_frame.description: A measurement of calories burned cannot be associated to a date-time, because it inherently lasts over time, so the effective time frame must be a time interval.

statistic_time_denominator.description: The time denominator of the descriptive statistic. For example, in the case of average daily calories burned, the value would be d.
